All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. EQUIP is designed to support the Government of Malawi’s (GoM) goal of reducing HIV incidence and mitigating the impact of the epidemic on people living with HIV (PLHIV). This will be achieved by increasing access to high quality comprehensive, outcome-driven HIV services across the continuum of care, and strengthening the capacity of the GoM to sustain these services. Achievement of this goal will include 1) earlier identification and linkage of infants, children, adolescents and adults needing services; 2) increased treatment coverage, retention, and viral suppression; 3) strengthened viral load monitoring and other necessary laboratory systems; 4) improved quality and efficiency of services; and, 5) strategic integration of HIV services with other health services. EQUIP will be implemented in fifteen of the Malawi’s twenty-eight districts (5 scale up to saturation, 2 aggressive scale up, 10 sustained). These 15 districts contribute to 56% of the PEPFAR supported sites in Malawi (63% in scale up districts), and 50% of PEPFAR FY17 TX_CURR targets.
